DataElement.preferredName: Study Subject Protocol Milestone Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that represents a common administrative landmark for a study subject in the course of a study. EXAMPLE(S): obtain informed consent, verify eligibility criteria, enroll, registration to a study, randomize, assignment to a treatment arm, start of on-study period, complete study visits, end of on-study period, exit trial, break treatment blind, protocol violation, premature withdrawal The period of time over which the activity is repeated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Study Subject Protocol Milestone Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Occurrences within some epochs that are initiated by a protocol-specified event. The most common protocol milestone is "Informed Consent Obtained" which usually documents the start of the study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Study Subject Protocol Milestone Administration Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Occurrences within some epochs that are initiated by a protocol-specified event. The most common protocol milestone is "Informed Consent Obtained" which usually documents the start of the study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
Occurrences within some epochs that are initiated by a protocol-specified event. The most common protocol milestone is "Informed Consent Obtained" which usually documents the start of the study.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
